org.eclipse.january.dataset

Interface Dataset

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDataset, ILazyDataset, IMetadataProvider, INameable, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CompoundDataset, DateDataset
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCompoundDataset, AbstractDataset, BooleanDataset, BooleanDatasetBase, ByteDataset, ComplexDoubleDataset, ComplexFloatDataset, CompoundByteDataset, CompoundDoubleDataset, CompoundFloatDataset, CompoundIntegerDataset, CompoundLongDataset, CompoundShortDataset, DateDatasetImpl, DoubleDataset, FloatDataset, IntegerDataset, LongDataset, ObjectDataset, ObjectDatasetBase, RGBDataset, ShortDataset, StringDataset, StringDatasetBase

    public interface Dataset
extends IDataset

    Interface for our implementation of dataset that adds a lot of extra functionality.

    Warning: It is important to note that methods (get*Abs() and set*Abs()) which use the absolute index must be used with care. In (sliced) views of datasets, neighbouring positions do not necessarily correspond to contiguous indexes. This is also the case with multi-element (or compound) items. Therefore index iterators should be used in conjunction with these methods unless the dataset can be proven to be not a view or be a wholly contiguous slice of a dataset; a copy or new dataset satisfies this criterion.

        boolean isCompatibleWith(ILazyDataset g)

        Returns:

      • checkCompatibility

        void checkCompatibility(ILazyDataset g)
                        throws IllegalArgumentException
        This method takes a dataset and checks its shape against the current dataset. If they are both of the same size, then this returns with no error, if there is a problem, then an error is thrown.
        Parameters:
        g - The dataset to be compared
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - This will be thrown if there is a problem with the compatibility

      • getTransposedView

        Dataset getTransposedView(int... axes)
        Description copied from interface: IDataset
        Permute copy of dataset's axes so that given order is old order: 
          axisPerm = (p(0), p(1),...) => newdata(n(0), n(1),...) = olddata(o(0), o(1), ...)
  such that n(i) = o(p(i)) for all i
        I.e. for a 3D dataset (1,0,2) implies the new dataset has its 1st dimension running along the old dataset's 2nd dimension and the new 2nd is the old 1st. The 3rd dimension is left unchanged.
        Specified by:
        getTransposedView in interface IDataset
        Specified by:
        getTransposedView in interface ILazyDataset
        Parameters:
        axes - if zero length then axes order reversed
        Returns:
        remapped view of data

      • transpose

        Dataset transpose(int... axes)
        See getTransposedView(int...)
        Returns:
        remapped copy of data

      • variance

        double variance()
        Returns:
        sample variance of whole dataset
        Since:
        2.0
        See Also:
        with isWholePopulation = false

      • variance

        double variance(boolean isWholePopulation,
              boolean... ignoreInvalids)
        The sample variance can be calculated in two ways: if the dataset is considered as the entire population then the sample variance is simply the second central moment: 
            sum((x_i - m)^2)/N
 where {x_i} are set of N population values and m is the mean
    m = sum(x_i)/N
        Otherwise, if the dataset is a set of samples (with replacement) from the population then 
            sum((x_i - m)^2)/(N-1)
 where {x_i} are set of N sample values and m is the unbiased estimate of the mean
    m = sum(x_i)/N
        Note that the second definition is also the unbiased estimator of population variance.
        Parameters:
        isWholePopulation -
        ignoreInvalids - - see max(int, boolean...)
        Returns:
        sample variance
        Since:
        2.0

      • variance

        Dataset variance(int axis)
        Parameters:
        axis -
        Returns:
        sample variance along axis in dataset
        See Also:
        with isWholePopulation = false

      • variance

        Dataset variance(int axis,
               boolean isWholePopulation,
               boolean... ignoreInvalids)
        Parameters:
        axis -
        isWholePopulation -
        ignoreInvalids - - see max(int, boolean...)
        Returns:
        sample variance along axis in dataset
        Since:
        2.0
        See Also:
        with isWholePopulation = false
